pr_title: Fix Stock View sometimes not showing all items

timeline.message: Fix Stock View sometimes not showing all items

timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText:
because this only uses the stack, not the amount.
both in the current, and my changed version.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: it gets the amount from the stack and adds it to the amount in the map. That should be enough
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: Should i change it back to how it was in the second commit then? that didn't change TileEntityRack at all.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: none of this should be necessary of the above.
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: does that mean you prefer leaving this alone like it was, and just changing the WindowHutAllInventory?
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: The above code is correct. It should not be the cause of any issue.
replies.author: Raycoms

timeline.message:
Move the fix back to WindowHutAllInventory

as that seems to be the prefered solution.

timeline.bodyText: This does not work officially, and even though it works in the current Mc version it is not officially supported. As such please change this to use itemstorage instances or use the proposed change by @Raycoms.
timeline.author: OrionDevelopment

replies.bodyText: should i just change the items list to use ItemStorage instead of ItemStack then?
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText: I did get rid of it now.
replies.author: ToMe25

timeline.message: Update this to no longer misuse ItemStacks

timeline.bodyText: Yes better, and make this a Map<ItemStorage, Integer> and increment the quantity in the. And keep ItemStorage the same
timeline.author: Raycoms
Raycoms

timeline.bodyText: Is like this OK, or do i have to find another way to set the amount of the ItemStorage?
timeline.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText:
Should be fine like this.
Did you test this?
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: If you want to suggest any more changes, i will look at it tomorrow, today its late enough :)
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText:
Looks fine for me now. Does this solve all the issues there were before?
Can you add an additional check to query the rack from the position of the building itself (it's not include din the list of containers, so it needs an additional line to add the stacks from it.
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText:
"Does this solve all the issues there were before?" idk, i don't know about many issues with this view, i just made this to fix the linked issue.
"Can you add an additional check to query the rack from the position of the building itself" I can do that, but i think lexustec said he is working on that, so i wouldn't put that in here.
replies.author: ToMe25

replies.bodyText:
"Can you add an additional check to query the rack from the position of the building itself"
I have a working version for the warehouse now, i will test it with some other buildings, and than hopefully push it.
replies.author: ToMe25

timeline.message:

of this.

Remove unnecessary import

also rename storage map to rackStorage
